results.title: Gloriana
results.creator_credit: Derek Bailey, Colin Graham, Channel 4 and RM Arts
results.brief_description: This made for television production of “Gloriana”, an opera in three acts, with music by Benjamin Britten and Libretto by William Plomer, was performed at the London Coliseum by the English National Opera with the English National Opera Orchestra and Chorus conducted by Mark Elder. “Gloriana” was first conceived when Benjamin Britten was asked to compose an opera to celebrate the Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II in 1953. It tells of the tragic liaison of love and conflict between Queen Elizabeth I and her much younger, but married, loyal admirer, Robert Devereux, Earl of Essex. For Elizabeth the role of Queen and her duty to her people was paramount, even beyond her personal love for the Earl of Essex. The consequences of this commitment by Elizabeth eventually lead to Devereux’s downfall and subsequent death. Lavish costumes, pageantry, pomp and ceremony, interspersed with tender sometimes melancholic moments, make for an entertaining and interesting portrayal of this very famous Queen of England. Superb performances by Sarah Walker (Queen Elizabeth I) and Anthony Rolfe Johnson (Robert Devereux, Earl of Essex) are supported by an equally talented cast including Jean Rigby (Frances, Countess of Essex), Neil Howlett (Charles Blount Lord Mountjoy), Elizabeth Vaughan (Penelope Lady Rich), Alan Opie (Sir Robert Cecil), Richard Van Allan (Sir Walter Raleigh) and Malcolm Donnelly (Henry Cuffe).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Derek Bailey, Colin Graham, Channel 4 and RM Arts

results.title: Gloria
results.creator_credit: John Cassavetes, Sam Shaw and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: An accountant in possession of a ledger that could convict a number of Mob “bosses” entrusts both the ledger and his son to Gloria for protection before being murdered. Reluctantly she takes the child and begins a life on the run while keeping the mob at bay. Gena Rowlands gives an outstanding performance in the title role that earned her an Oscar nomination.

results.title: Glooscap country
results.brief_description: Ancient legend of the Micmac Indians of Nova Scotia. The rich scenic panorama of Nova Scotia’s Minas Basin gives substance to the story of Glooscap, an Indian God who was believed to live on what is now Cape Blomidon and from his mountain retreat to watch over his people in the valleys and forests below.

results.title: Globehunters
results.brief_description: With art direction by John Eng and Steve Meyers this ‘around the world in 80 days adventure’ is the animated tale of three highly intelligent animals created in a laboratory. The lab is going to be closed and a hunter will be rounding up the animals. The ape, Eddie, leopard, Sacia (Chaka Khan) and parrot, Trevor (voice imitation expert), escape to be tracked down by The Hunter (voice by Willem Dafoe) the world over for the next 80 days. An adventurous film with a few musical numbers thrown in but its ‘look’ could be interpreted as somewhat hard-edged. The three friends use their intelligence (including street-smart dialogue) and bond of friendship to get themselves out of some tricky situations. Originally made for television but released on DVD.

results.title: Global insights 4
results.brief_description:
Global Insights 4 is a compilation of short video works of a subversive political nature, sourced from videoactivists, cultural saboteurs and ‘serious’ documentary-makers from around the world.
Pieces featured include an alternative US response to the incidents of September 11 2001, made by Indymedia NYC soon after the event; scenes from the front line of the democracy struggle in Malaysia. A remarkable sequence of (unarmed) indigenous peasants in Mexico taking over an army base; a Korean perspective on the rise of the new global economic orthodoxy and the resistance to it; the ‘no borders’ movement in Europe and Australia against the deportation and detention of refugees.
Adverts peppered throughout the program are actually ‘subverts’ - biting satirical 30-second statements about consumerism, gender, sexuality and possibilities for reshaping the world. Producers of this form range from disaffected advertisers to teenagers with an ironic message about climate change.
The Global Insights videos have seen hundreds of free public screenings from Tamil Nadu to Antarctica - inspiring grass-roots people’s action and fostering an independent and accessible screen culture globally.
Global Insights is put together on a miniscule budget by volunteers. It is a collaboration between hundreds of independent media makers around the world.

results.title: Global Gardener
results.creator_credit: Julian Russell, Tony Gailey and 220 Productions
results.brief_description: Four half-hour episodes on permaculture, a concept pioneered by the program’s host, Bill Mollison. Permaculture (permanent agriculture) is the opposite of monoculture and is a way of caring for the earth so that it provides household needs, is economically viable and ecologically sound. Contents: 1. “In the Tropics” - the principles of permaculture and examples in Zimbabwe and India. 2. “Arid Lands” - examples in Botswana, Arizona and Australia to roll back the desert. 3. “Cool Climates” - covers Tasmania and England. 4. “Urban” - examples of sustainable agriculture in polluted urban environments.

results.title: Global energy game
results.creator_credit: Paul Galan, Michael Joseloff and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description: Economic journalist Adam Smith hosts a group of six players each representing a different country as they play a simulated game of international oil and global energy. Covers the trade balance and inflation in terms of oil costs and American dependence on foreign oil.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Galan, Michael Joseloff and Gateway Film Productions

results.title: Glitterball (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An alien spaceship crashlands on earth. It’s piloted by the Glitterball, a small silver creature with amazing powers, and an appetite for human food. With the help of two small boys, Glitterball causes chaos, and a lot of laughs as it eats its way back to outer space.
